revised_title: Comparative Analysis of Cochlea Structure in Ornithorhynchus Platypus, Birds, and Mammals
tldr: The author compares the cochlea structure of the Ornithorhynchus platypus, birds, and mammals, highlighting the differences and similarities between them. The platypus cochlea shares more resemblance with birds than mammals, having a curved tube with a slightly enlarged rounded apex. The interior of the platypus cochlea is divided into two unequal parts by a lamina, with the outer portion being bony and the inner portion membranous. The author also describes the scala media or ductus cochleae, which is the membranous labyrinth of the cochlea.
